availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard Samuel Edelin (Marion County, Kentucky, student, farmer, distiller, politician, and butcher)

body.p: Marion County, Kentucky, student, farmer, distiller, politician, and butcher. Kentucky native. Son of Christopher Edelen and Ann C. Edelen. Married to Mary Ellen Lancaster in Marion County, Kentucky, on December 22, 1859. Father of Alice Edelen and Christopher Edelen. Student in Marion County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned ten enslaved persons in Marion County in 1850. Farmer in Washington County in 1860. Farmer in Washington County in 1863. Distiller in Marion County in 1864. President of the Lebanon Board of Trustees in Marion County in 1864. Butcher in Washington County in 1865.
